list.description: The BMW 8 Series is a luxury grand tourer produced from 1989 to 1999.

The BMW E30 is a compact executive car that was produced by the German automaker BMW from 1982 to 1994. It is part of the BMW 3 Series and is widely regarded as one of the brand's iconic models. The E30 gained popularity for its combination of sporty performance, elegant design, and driving dynamics.
The BMW 3 Series (E36) is the third generation of the 3 Series, produced from 1990 to 2000.

The W124 Coupe is known for its elegant and timeless design. As part of the W124 series, it shares many features with its sedan counterpart but features a sleeker two-door body style. The W124 generation, produced from 1984 to 1996, is often praised for its build quality, safety innovations, and advanced engineering.
The BMW Z3 is a two-seater convertible and coupe produced from 1995 to 2002.
The Mercedes-Benz S-Class Coupe (C140) is a luxury grand tourer produced from 1992 to 1999.

The W126 Coupe, also known as the SEC (S-Klasse Erweiterte Coup√©), is celebrated for its classic and luxurious design. The coupe variant of the W126 series features a two-door body style, combining the elegance of a luxury sedan with a sleek coupe silhouette. These vehicles are often recognized for their high build quality, advanced safety features, and innovative technology for their time.
The Mercedes-Benz SLK-Class is a compact luxury roadster produced from 1996 to 2004.

The BMW E24 featured a classic, shark-nose design, which became iconic for the era. It was a two-door coupe designed for comfortable long-distance cruising, blending sporty characteristics with a luxurious interior. The E24 was often praised for its sophisticated styling and advanced features.
